004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.Radians;
008
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonAutoDetect;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.MathSharedStore;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.proto.Rotation2dProto;
016import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.struct.Rotation2dStruct;
017import edu.wpi.first.math.interpolation.Interpolatable;
018import edu.wpi.first.math.util.Units;
019import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Angle;
020import edu.wpi.first.util.protobuf.ProtobufSerializable;
021import edu.wpi.first.util.struct.StructSerializable;
022import java.util.Objects;
023
024/**
025 * A rotation in a 2D coordinate frame represented by a point on the unit circle (cosine and sine).
026 *
027 * <p>The angle is continuous, that is if a Rotation2d is constructed with 361 degrees, it will
028 * return 361 degrees. This allows algorithms that wouldn't want to see a discontinuity in the
029 * rotations as it sweeps past from 360 to 0 on the second time around.
030 */
031@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
032@JsonAutoDetect(getterVisibility = JsonAutoDetect.Visibility.NONE)
033public class Rotation2d
034    implements Interpolatable<Rotation2d>, ProtobufSerializable, StructSerializable {
035  /**
036   * A preallocated Rotation2d representing no rotation.
037   *
038   * <p>This exists to avoid allocations for common rotations.
039   */
040  public static final Rotation2d kZero = new Rotation2d();
041
042  /**
043   * A preallocated Rotation2d representing a clockwise rotation by π/2 rad (90°).
044   *
045   * <p>This exists to avoid allocations for common rotations.
046   */
047  public static final Rotation2d kCW_Pi_2 = new Rotation2d(-Math.PI / 2);
048
049  /**
050   * A preallocated Rotation2d representing a clockwise rotation by 90° (π/2 rad).
051   *
052   * <p>This exists to avoid allocations for common rotations.
053   */
054  public static final Rotation2d kCW_90deg = kCW_Pi_2;
055
056  /**
057   * A preallocated Rotation2d representing a counterclockwise rotation by π/2 rad (90°).
058   *
059   * <p>This exists to avoid allocations for common rotations.
060   */
061  public static final Rotation2d kCCW_Pi_2 = new Rotation2d(Math.PI / 2);
062
063  /**
064   * A preallocated Rotation2d representing a counterclockwise rotation by 90° (π/2 rad).
065   *
066   * <p>This exists to avoid allocations for common rotations.
067   */
068  public static final Rotation2d kCCW_90deg = kCCW_Pi_2;
069
070  /**
071   * A preallocated Rotation2d representing a counterclockwise rotation by π rad (180°).
072   *
073   * <p>This exists to avoid allocations for common rotations.
074   */
075  public static final Rotation2d kPi = new Rotation2d(Math.PI);
076
077  /**
078   * A preallocated Rotation2d representing a counterclockwise rotation by 180° (π rad).
079   *
080   * <p>This exists to avoid allocations for common rotations.
081   */
082  public static final Rotation2d k180deg = kPi;
083
084  private final double m_value;
085  private final double m_cos;
086  private final double m_sin;
087
088  /** Constructs a Rotation2d with a default angle of 0 degrees. */
089  public Rotation2d() {
090    m_value = 0.0;
091    m_cos = 1.0;
092    m_sin = 0.0;
093  }
094
095  /**
096   * Constructs a Rotation2d with the given radian value.
097   *
098   * @param value The value of the angle in radians.
099   */
100  @JsonCreator
101  public Rotation2d(@JsonProperty(required = true, value = "radians") double value) {
102    m_value = value;
103    m_cos = Math.cos(value);
104    m_sin = Math.sin(value);
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Constructs a Rotation2d with the given x and y (cosine and sine) components.
109   *
110   * @param x The x component or cosine of the rotation.
111   * @param y The y component or sine of the rotation.
112   */
113  public Rotation2d(double x, double y) {
114    double magnitude = Math.hypot(x, y);
115    if (magnitude > 1e-6) {
116      m_sin = y / magnitude;
117      m_cos = x / magnitude;
118    } else {
119      m_sin = 0.0;
120      m_cos = 1.0;
121      MathSharedStore.reportError(
122          "x and y components of Rotation2d are zero\n", Thread.currentThread().getStackTrace());
123    }
124    m_value = Math.atan2(m_sin, m_cos);
125  }
126
127  /**
128   * Constructs a Rotation2d with the given angle.
129   *
130   * @param angle The angle of the rotation.
131   */
132  public Rotation2d(Angle angle) {
133    this(angle.in(Radians));
134  }
135
136  /**
137   * Constructs and returns a Rotation2d with the given radian value.
138   *
139   * @param radians The value of the angle in radians.
140   * @return The rotation object with the desired angle value.
141   */
142  public static Rotation2d fromRadians(double radians) {
143    return new Rotation2d(radians);
144  }
145
146  /**
147   * Constructs and returns a Rotation2d with the given degree value.
148   *
149   * @param degrees The value of the angle in degrees.
150   * @return The rotation object with the desired angle value.
151   */
152  public static Rotation2d fromDegrees(double degrees) {
153    return new Rotation2d(Math.toRadians(degrees));
154  }
155
156  /**
157   * Constructs and returns a Rotation2d with the given number of rotations.
158   *
159   * @param rotations The value of the angle in rotations.
160   * @return The rotation object with the desired angle value.
161   */
162  public static Rotation2d fromRotations(double rotations) {
163    return new Rotation2d(Units.rotationsToRadians(rotations));
164  }
165
166  /**
167   * Adds two rotations together, with the result being bounded between -pi and pi.
168   *
169   * <p>For example, <code>Rotation2d.fromDegrees(30).plus(Rotation2d.fromDegrees(60))</code> equals
170   * <code>Rotation2d(Math.PI/2.0)</code>
171   *
172   * @param other The rotation to add.
173   * @return The sum of the two rotations.
174   */
175  public Rotation2d plus(Rotation2d other) {
176    return rotateBy(other);
177  }
178
179  /**
180   * Subtracts the new rotation from the current rotation and returns the new rotation.
181   *
182   * <p>For example, <code>Rotation2d.fromDegrees(10).minus(Rotation2d.fromDegrees(100))</code>
183   * equals <code>Rotation2d(-Math.PI/2.0)</code>
184   *
185   * @param other The rotation to subtract.
186   * @return The difference between the two rotations.
187   */
188  public Rotation2d minus(Rotation2d other) {
189    return rotateBy(other.unaryMinus());
190  }
191
192  /**
193   * Takes the inverse of the current rotation. This is simply the negative of the current angular
194   * value.
195   *
196   * @return The inverse of the current rotation.
197   */
198  public Rotation2d unaryMinus() {
199    return new Rotation2d(-m_value);
200  }
201
202  /**
203   * Multiplies the current rotation by a scalar.
204   *
205   * @param scalar The scalar.
206   * @return The new scaled Rotation2d.
207   */
208  public Rotation2d times(double scalar) {
209    return new Rotation2d(m_value * scalar);
210  }
211
212  /**
213   * Divides the current rotation by a scalar.
214   *
215   * @param scalar The scalar.
216   * @return The new scaled Rotation2d.
217   */
218  public Rotation2d div(double scalar) {
219    return times(1.0 / scalar);
220  }
221
222  /**
223   * Adds the new rotation to the current rotation using a rotation matrix.
224   *
225   * <p>The matrix multiplication is as follows:
226   *
227   * <pre>
228   * [cos_new]   [other.cos, -other.sin][cos]
229   * [sin_new] = [other.sin,  other.cos][sin]
230   * value_new = atan2(sin_new, cos_new)
231   * </pre>
232   *
233   * @param other The rotation to rotate by.
234   * @return The new rotated Rotation2d.
235   */
236  public Rotation2d rotateBy(Rotation2d other) {
237    return new Rotation2d(
238        m_cos * other.m_cos - m_sin * other.m_sin, m_cos * other.m_sin + m_sin * other.m_cos);
239  }
240
241  /**
242   * Returns the measure of the Rotation2d.
243   *
244   * @return The measure of the Rotation2d.
245   */
246  public Angle getMeasure() {
247    return Radians.of(getRadians());
248  }
249
250  /**
251   * Returns the radian value of the Rotation2d.
252   *
253   * @return The radian value of the Rotation2d.
254   * @see edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil#angleModulus(double) to constrain the angle within (-pi, pi]
255   */
256  @JsonProperty
257  public double getRadians() {
258    return m_value;
259  }
260
261  /**
262   * Returns the degree value of the Rotation2d.
263   *
264   * @return The degree value of the Rotation2d.
265   * @see edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil#inputModulus(double, double, double) to constrain the angle
266   *     within (-180, 180]
267   */
268  public double getDegrees() {
269    return Math.toDegrees(m_value);
270  }
271
272  /**
273   * Returns the number of rotations of the Rotation2d.
274   *
275   * @return The number of rotations of the Rotation2d.
276   */
277  public double getRotations() {
278    return Units.radiansToRotations(m_value);
279  }
280
281  /**
282   * Returns the cosine of the Rotation2d.
283   *
284   * @return The cosine of the Rotation2d.
285   */
286  public double getCos() {
287    return m_cos;
288  }
289
290  /**
291   * Returns the sine of the Rotation2d.
292   *
293   * @return The sine of the Rotation2d.
294   */
295  public double getSin() {
296    return m_sin;
297  }
298
299  /**
300   * Returns the tangent of the Rotation2d.
301   *
302   * @return The tangent of the Rotation2d.
303   */
304  public double getTan() {
305    return m_sin / m_cos;
306  }
307
308  @Override
309  public String toString() {
310    return String.format("Rotation2d(Rads: %.2f, Deg: %.2f)", m_value, Math.toDegrees(m_value));
311  }
312
313  /**
314   * Checks equality between this Rotation2d and another object.
315   *
316   * @param obj The other object.
317   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
318   */
319  @Override
320  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
321    return obj instanceof Rotation2d other
322        && Math.hypot(m_cos - other.m_cos, m_sin - other.m_sin) < 1E-9;
323  }
324
325  @Override
326  public int hashCode() {
327    return Objects.hash(m_value);
328  }
329
330  @Override
331  public Rotation2d interpolate(Rotation2d endValue, double t) {
332    return plus(endValue.minus(this).times(MathUtil.clamp(t, 0, 1)));
333  }
334
335  /** Rotation2d protobuf for serialization. */
336  public static final Rotation2dProto proto = new Rotation2dProto();
337
338  /** Rotation2d struct for serialization. */
339  public static final Rotation2dStruct struct = new Rotation2dStruct();
340}
